H0.text: Photosynthesis is the process by which plants make the simple sugar glucose from carbon dioxide and water.

H1.text: Glycolysis is the process by which plants make the simple sugar glucose from carbon dioxide and water.

H2.text: Metamorphosis is the process by which plants make the simple sugar glucose from carbon dioxide and water.

H3.text: Osmosis is the process by which plants make the simple sugar glucose from carbon dioxide and water.

A4.text: photosynthesis captures energy from sunlight to convert carbon dioxide into carbohydrates

A5.text: the simple carbon sugars photosynthesis produces are then used to form other organic compounds, such as... glucose
